item.name: Drover's Cap
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): The Worshipful Guild of Drovers and Carters of the City of Waterdeep commissioned these Caps for their members. We have asked for and received permission to offer them to the rest of the Sword Coast in order to improve business relations across the Trade Way. You gain a +1 bonus to your (Wisdom) Animal Handling and Intelligence (Nature) checks.

item.name: Sage's Spectacles
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): The Spectacles contain 4 unreplenishable charges of the comprehend languages spell.

item.name: Sentinel's Amulet
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): An amulet on an unremable chain.

{@bold Features} (GM): When you first attune to this item, you must think of a certain creature you have encountered before. Thereafter, the Amulet glows faintly when a creature of that race comes within 100 feet of you.

item.name: Liar's Spectacles
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This eyewear has the power to distract the person you're talking to, making them pay less attention to what you're saying. You gain a +1 bonus to your Charisma (Deception) checks.

item.name: Bold Mask of Safety
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): Once per day, you may use your reaction to reduce fall damage by 1d6. The Mask also contains 4 unreplenishable charges of the heroism spell (1st level).

item.name: Liar's Cap of Nourishment
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): You gain a +1 bonus to your Charisma (Deception) checks. You rarely feel hungry, and only need to consume one-fifth the usual amount of food.

item.name: Pious Hammer
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): You may spend ten minutes praying and paying honor to the the god to which the Hammer is dedicated, shaving your head and facial hair in tribute. Once the ceremony is finished, the Hammer becomes a +1 weapon until the end of the next long rest. The Hammer also channels 1d4 points of divine energy on a critical hit; this damage is either radiant, force, or necrotic, depending on the alignment of the god to which the Hammer is dedicated (good, neutral, and evil, respectively). You must wait 10 days until you have hair long enough to re-enact this ritual.

item.name: Tetsubo of Tithes
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): You may lay 10 gold coins along the surface of the weapon and pray to a god of your choice for 10 minutes. At the end of this ritual, the 10 gold coins are permanently gone and the weapon becomes a +1 weapon for 1 hour. This boon will be lost if you act in a way that is contradictory to that deity's teachings.

item.name: Malignant Spear
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): When used to make an attack of opportunity, the Spear does an additional 1d4 damage.

item.name: Dagger of Warding
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Dagger with a deep fuller

{@bold Features} (GM): Once per long rest the wielder may draw a line up to 20 feet long upon the ground with this weapon. The line lasts for 1 minute. Undead must succeed on a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw to move across this line.

item.name: Dead Truncheon
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): If this weapon is entombed within a corpse for 8 hours, it becomes a +1 magic weapon until the next dawn.

item.name: Violent Dagger
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): Every time you roll a critical hit when attacking with the Dagger, it gains 1 charge. As a bonus action, you may use a charge to make the Dagger a +1 weapon for 1 minute. All charges are lost at the end of a short or long rest.

item.name: Blithe Blade
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): While attuned to the Blithe Blade, you are filled with joy obvious to all who observe you. All your Charisma-based skill and saving throw rolls gain a +1 bonus, but all your Wisdom-based skill and saving throw rolls suffer a -1 penalty. This can be any type of sword.

item.name: Speedy Boots
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): The Boots contain 4 unreplenishable charges of the expeditious retreat spell.

item.name: Compassionate Ring
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): The Ring contains 4 unreplenishable charges of the cure wounds spell (1st level).

item.name: Revealing Ring
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): This Ring contains 4 unreplenishable charges of the detect magic spell (1st level).

item.name: Ring of Servants
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): The Ring contains 4 unreplenishable charges of the unseen servant spell.

item.name: Channeling Ring
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): Once per long rest, you may ignore the Verbal and/or Somatic components of a spell you cast.

item.name: Reaper's Ring
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): One of our most popular items! Many an adventurer wearing a Reaper's Ring has written to tell us of how it saved their life in the wildnerness. Will you take the chance? You have advantage on death saving throws.

item.name: Ring of Analysis
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): Made by student wizards of the High Mage of Silverymoon to aid them in their studies, many adventuring students of the Weave use these Rings to help them understand the Weave and how it works. You gain +1 to your Intelligence (Arcana) checks.

item.name: Alarming Wand
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): The Wand contains 4 unreplenishable charges of the alarm spell.

item.name: Inquisitor's Medallion
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A medallion with the symbol of the City Watch wrought in Electrum.
{@bold Features} (GM): Commissioned by the City Watch of Waterdeep, this Medallion grants you +1 to your to Intelligence (Investigation) and Wisdom (Insight) checks.

item.name: Sacred Boots
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): The Order of the Silver Shield, a growing group of Paladins of Ilmater hailing from Neverwinter, commissioned these Boots to aid their holy mission. They readily granted their permission for us to produce more Boots for Paladins of any good order. If you can use the Paladin Lay On Hands power, you may increase your Lay on Hands hit point pool by 5.

item.name: Eavesdropper's Gloves
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): Very much sought after by spies, the Eavesdropper's Gloves are very useful in the right hands and very dangerous in the wrong ones. See our Disclaimer! As long as you are both on the same plane of existence, you can hear through the Gloves as if you were in the same room as them.

item.name: Secret Agent's Gloves
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): Developed under contract for the agents of a Zulkir of Thay, these Gloves are in high demand all along the Sword Coast. While worn, the Gloves grant Advantage to Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) checks and Dexterity checks using Thieves Tools.

item.name: Inspired Medallion
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): You gain your Constitution modifier in temporary hit points whenever you gain or use Inspiration.

item.name: Conjurer's Circlet of Trickery
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): Aristobulus happened upon a street performer in Baldur's Gate using a simple item to enhance his act. Plying the girl with wine and charm, he examined the item enough to spend a few weeks reverse-engineering a copy for your benefit. You may cast prestidigitation and minor illusion once per day each.

item.name: Pendant of Bounty
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): The Pendant contains 4 unreplenishable charges of the goodberry spell.

item.name: Tiara of Malediction
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): The Tiara contains 4 unreplenishable charges of the bane spell (1st level).

item.name: Milo's Medallion
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): Developed to special order for the famed Halfling Bard Milo of Timbertown, this Medallion is very useful indeed! He has given us permission to offer it exclusively to our valued customers. You gain +1 to your Charisma (Performance) checks. The Medallion also contains 4 unreplenishable charges of the cure wounds spell (1st level).

item.name: Pendant of the Surgeon
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): You gain a +1 bonus to your Wisdom (Medicine) checks.

item.name: Scrapper's Tenacious Boots
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): While wearing the Boots, when you take a short rest you may regain hit points from one additional hit die without counting it toward your total allowed.

item.name: Vigilant Scabbard
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): You gain a +1 bonus to your Initiative rolls.

item.name: Vigilant Bracers of Compassion
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): You gain +2 to your Passive Perception. The Bracers contain 4 unreplenishable charges of the cure wounds spell (1st level).

item.name: True Bracers
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): You may cast true strike once per long rest.

item.name: Fox's Leathers
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): While you wear this armor, creatures trying to track you do so with Disadvantage.

item.name: Brawler's Leathers
entries: {@bold Features} (GM): While attuned to and wearing this Armor, whenever you make an unarmed attack or an attack with an improvised weapon, the Armor becomes +1 armor until the beginning of your next turn.

item.name: Mockingbird Citydweller's Leathers
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Consisting of a finely-tailored suit of doublet and breeches made of supple leather, the armor can pass for mere clothing.

{@bold Features} (GM): While attuned to and wearing the Leathers, when you finish a long rest in a city of more than 10,000 inhabitants the Leathers become +1 armor, and you gain the ability to cast vicious mockery once per day. If you leave the city, the magic becomes inert until you finish another long rest in a city as described.
